benchmark_details.name: AmbGIMT (Gender-Inclusive Machine Translation with Ambiguous attitude words)
benchmark_details.overview: AmbGIMT is a gender-inclusive machine translation benchmark that assesses gender bias beyond binary gender by utilizing ambiguous emotional attitude words and an Emotional Attitude Score (EAS) metric.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate gender-inclusive translations with ambiguous attitude words and assess gender bias in machine translation.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited to a single translation language pair (English-Chinese) and does not include all possible non-binary pronoun usages.

data.source: Authentic and synthesized English sentences with ambiguous attitude words and expert Chinese translations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated by comparing the translation outputs against reference translations using COMET and BLEU scores.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better translation quality, while lower scores reflect poorer performance, specifically assessing gender bias.
methodology.baseline_results: The experimental results show up to 10 COMET points lower for non-binary identities compared to binary gender contexts.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through human judgment and consistency checks (Kappa coefficient > 0.8).

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark covers 14 types of non-binary gender identities.
